title: So the Ryze changes...
body: Pretty much dumpstered him if you knew what you were doing at all. Hell, even if you didn't know what you were doing, you could smack your face against the keyboard and get more then five spells off. I really don't see why this occurred beyond 'we want Ryze to suck until his next rework.'

replies.body: The 6.3 changes hit Ryze quite hard. Ryze has been a real problem champion basically forever, with issues the most recent rework failed to address. That meant that in his state pre 6.3, despite being extremely weak for new to average players, he was excessively strong when played well, to the extent we felt we had to limit his best case scenarios. We'll now look at where we can add power that benefits both new and experienced players, potentially starting with restoring the damage cut from his Q back in 5.14.

Key question: in the long-term, are you going to try to balance Ryze around this new limitation (the spell-cast cap)? Or are you going to try to make him playable but not oppressive while you work on a larger rework?

I've asked this multiple times, and I would really appreciate an answer, even if that answer is "we haven't decided yet".

To be frank, I don't know, though expect we'll be looking at Ryze changes in more than just 6.4.

Whatever the approach we decide on is though it'll need to be one where Ryze can be balanced to be at least tolerably effective for the average player without being way out of line when played really well.

>Whatever the approach we decide on is though it'll need to be one where Ryze can be balanced to be at least tolerably effective for the average player without being extremely nuts when played really well.

To be honest I think post rework Ryze is actually worse than pre rework in this area. Old Ryze felt more simple as a character and had a lot of hidden complexity while new Ryze is just a hot mess.

I'm not saying old Ryze was good but I seriously think new Ryze was a giant step back from it.
I'm glad I'm not alone here. Old Ryze was annoying and a pain. But new Ryze... my god how did it make it past internal testing?
So he's exactly like Cassiopeia, Skarner and Mordekaiser.

Greetings,

Whatever you do, the imperative is to remove that 5 spell cap as soon as possible and come out with a different long-term solution beneficial to a wider range of elo tiers.
A more reasonable and a novel approach to balancing Ryze is absolutely necessary.
Another rework and the expenditure of resources is unnecessary if provided a deeper commitment on this mini-project.

Ryze defies the logic of a standard definition of "unbalanced".

I am a veteran gamer (from the time of Amiga 500, Pentium I, etc.), and I enjoy League of Legends and the whole eSports project Riot has produced.
I've had a period during which I wasn't actively playing games because of the start of my career in game development, CGI and IT engineering.
Now amidst a stable income of project opportunities, I easily find spare time to relax and enjoy playing games again.

I might be a little rusty now gameplay-wise, but the core understanding of the game never leaves. :-)

Ryze has always been my favorite champion and I've literally studied Ryze since the beginning, understanding thoroughly his mechanics, mathematics and his play strategy.
* As a side note, even more so I admire your utilization of the Elizabethan writing style of his lore, his encounter with Lilith - reminiscent of the works of H.Blavatsky, A.Crowley, et al.

I'm willing to propose some ideas in bringing the rouge mage to a better state of balance that could make both gameplay and commercial benefits, thus I've submitted a PBE account request some time ago.

All the best !

As an average player, this nerf was uncalled for. It doesn't lower his skill floor (like with alistar this patch), but decimates his skill cap harder than Darius will to Ryze this patch. 
I am bronze, but even I will know how hard this hits Ryze. Tell me what proof is there at all that Ryze is overpowered? His win rate isn't very good even in higher levels. The only basis is that it "feels" broken when he permaroots.
If he had cute furry ears and large breasts, this nonsense wouldn't have happened. The earlier nerfs aren't enough? He was fine 6.2, even a bit weak for anybody who isn't a korean challenger. Only because Faker used him at worlds, he's now considered broken. I recall he was considered garbage before.
I do think it's good the Rogue Mage is being balanced, but the spell cap is terrible, and I suggest it be removed. This spell cap will screw him over in all leagues (worse on those higher up).
I wonder if whoever decided this was a good idea in PBE actually plays the game, or at least understands how Ryze works. Brandon Beck would be disappointed.

Honestly give him back his old skill rotation mechanic. Now that he can't build RoA or BV in his build it is perfectly legit. Also you'll never run into perma stacking because he can only go 2 full skill rotations before his ult cd gets in the way. This way you still have his machine gun approach but he is no longer tanky like previously, nor does he just insta gib you with a million spells at once.

Hey Meddler, 

I tried a couple games of the new 5 spell rotation mechanic and it isn't that bad. I actually really like it and think it's much more balanced that it was before. 

Before, you just got 4 stacks then you proceeded to 1 v 1 the enemy and kill them with an insane amount of spells if you are a veteran player, but now, you actually have to take trades and multiple passive activations before deciding when to all in the enemy. I think this mechanic is much better that the previous passive. 

The only problem with this new change is that now his late game is extremely awkward. You are supposed to pick ryze for the late game, and the previous ryze late game allowed you to really hammer down on opponents with a flurry of spells, unbridled by nothing.

Now however, the gaps between his passive really make it awkward in team fights where you are left just standing there waiting for cool downs, which feels very bad. The ultimate cool down change is very very good because it kinda because in late game team fights it become permanently on, which is really cool and thematic for a late game dps mage like ryze. I just feel like if he was able to just chain spells better late game (after level 16) ryze will be in a perfect spot.

Honestly, I don't see how he can be balanced without just jacking up his damage to stupid extents. His normal spells already hit decently hard; any changes to balance them under the assumption he can only cast five spells per passive proc would probably raise his poke to unbearable levels.

And, to be frank, getting only five casts per combo simply makes him less fun. Every time I would proc my passive, I'd get ready for an epic chain of spells...and then I'd hit five spells and I'm just standing there, confused and bored.

I dont get what you are complaining about, word yourself better please.

one moment your calling him op

One moment your calling him bad

which is it.

He is currently bad, due to the changes handicapping his ult for literally everyone.

Riot doesn't seem to know how to balance Ryze, as this is his second rework, I think. I'm assuming they're just making him terrible until the next rework.

Also a simple Garen rushing BC and Garen rushing Spirit Visage.... :-)

Ryze, to me, has felt extremely clunky since his last rework with his unsteady cooldown reduction and alternating rotations, and it seems like this change would make things feel even worse as every time Ryze gets going he then comes to an abrupt stop at the end of his passive proc.

Has Riot considered a 'cast buffer' window for Ryze similar to what you just did for Alistar's combo to help ease the impact of players with poor APM or ping? I think that would also go a long way towards mellowing out his lows in addition to just making him feel better to play.

Oh yeah. The reason I posted this was because I got him in an ARAM game and even I, who doesn't play Ryze at all, kept thinking 'wait that's the end of my combo?'

It felt terrible.
